title.narrative: GEM - Afrique : communication aux fins de la mobilisation de ressources, de l'influence sur les politiques et de la visibilité
GEM Africa: Messaging for Resource Expansion, Policy Influence, and Visibility

description.narrative:
IDRC's Global Entrepreneurship Monitor (GEM) Africa project participants need communications training to support their efforts to reach out to donors, communicate with policymakers, and increase the visibility of their research. The Africa program has 10 research teams. Through IDRC's Supporting Inclusive Growth (SIG) program, they have received training in resource expansion. To strengthen their fundraising efforts, communications training is a must.
Through this project, SIG will provide and fund the following workshops: -two-day training on project roll out; and, -three-day academic writing workshop for researchers.
The project rollout workshop will explore where communication for visibility fits into resource expansion, policy relevance, and visibility, and how this compares to academic writing. The writing workshop (or writeshop) will include one-on-one meetings with each of the 10 research teams to discuss customized messaging that takes each team's national policy landscapes into account, and their current progress with resource expansion.
Funding will be used to hire a consultant for the following activities: -review documentation; -prepare the deliverables; -run the two-day project rollout workshop; -offer the three-day writeshop; and, -prepare a customized suite of detailed messaging that brings together progress made during the writeshop, and that responds to the team's policy landscape and current resource expansion opportunities.
